page.title: 15ECOLOGY
page.content: { Crostwick Common}is uncultivated ,a place for wild plants and birds.It is a peaceful place a place for quiet walks.Hawthorn and blackthorn bushes grow here,there is also a boggy area where some rare plants grow. The school's{young ornithologist { club}regularly visit the Common, especially in the spring, to see and hear the many warblers that return each year to breed there. A stream ,the Beck, is one of the natural boundaries of the common.The North Walsham Road passes through the middle of the Common cutting it in two.On one side of the road the common is quite dry ,Crostwick Church is here,the other side of the road is the boggy area. Crostwick Common is Spixworth's special nature reserve.
